wikipedia_page.main: Mary Katrina Anne MacLeod (6 July 1937 – 7 June 2016) was an English-born Scottish actress who performed on the stage and in film and television productions of the United Kingdom. Born in the Midlands market town of Wednesbury to Scottish parents, she debuted in theatre in 1956 and had her first British cinema role in the Lindsay Anderson film  if.... (1968). MacLeod continued to feature in minor roles until her career was ended early by a stroke in 2003.

*Mary MacLeod as Mrs. Ball / Salvationist / Vicar's wife
* Mary MacLeod as Mrs. Kemp, housemaster's wife

The black and white sequence featuring Mrs Kemp (Mary MacLeod) walking naked through the school was allowed by the then Secretary of the Board of the British Board of Film Censors, John Trevelyan, on the condition that shots of male genitalia from the shower scene were removed.
